comment._content: Really, the Opera House is unbeatable. The fort matches Gov House doesn't it? But would not have become an icon of Oz.

comment._content: don't know about anyone else but those lovely wooden dories in the foreground have got my vote

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Give it back to Bennelong and his family!

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content:
It is rare to see a photo of the actual Fort Macquarie.

The boats are lovely too! but the cropping suggests that they were secondary to the photographer's intentions

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/highranger] There are several photos of Fort Macquarie in this collection - I have been tagging them when I remember.  My favourite, by Henry King (like this) - 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363488946/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I just noticed this photo is part of a PANORAMA - hence the slightly odd composition, with the boats "secondary".  This joins on to the right -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2514725441/]


... and I bet there are more to be found ...

comment._content: Wow! Lot's more research needed here. Thanks for the link Beachcomber

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
Spanner in the works! - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Have you considered this could be the second photo?
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362650959/](which would rule out the regatta photos as being part of the same panorama) ...

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02]Look at the surface of the water between photos number one and two -  the choppiness is different. Even pellthepoet's discovery of a possible No 2 has the same problem. 

Also I would suggest that the paddle steamer is off Bradleys Head whereas the background to the Fort Maquarie picture is Kirribilli. I think the Fort Macquarie shot was taken from the vicinity of Man O War steps so we need a shot showing Kirribilli House on Kirribilli Point for a possible candidate for No 2.

And in response to pellthepoet's (PTP's) question ... yes I saw beachcomberaustralia's (BCA's) amazing powers of observation and detection at work with his previous panorama.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet]  Hmm .... you could well be right.  As [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper]  says, more research required.  There could well be other Henry King photos involved.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] We will sort it all out.  You'll see a note on the paddle steamer photo that Admiralty House / Wotonga does not have the upstairs addition yet, which might help date it
